result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Joshua Ryan Miggler was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Ryan Miggler is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joshua Ryan Miggler was found guilty of Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Injunction, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).
  • Joshua Ryan Miggler was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court dismisses Counts 2, 3, 5, 6, 8, and 9.
Defendant to meet with the Diversion Coordinator.
Defendant to report to Probation today June 29, 2016.
Court notes 117 days credit against ultimate sentence.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Count 7

miscConds.notes:

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
-Domestic Violence Assessment and follow through with all recommendation. Follow through can be completed within 2 year agreement.
-Attend Victim Empathy Seminar with Restorative Justice.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment, if required by Agent.

signed by Def & Atty this date. eif

*AMENDED* 
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Stacey M. The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Fox, ADA:  Megan E. Kelly, DF ATTY:  Daniel Frank Demaio, DF:  Joshua Ryan Miggler appeared. Victim Witness P. Bellrichard in court. Includes 15CF375, 15CF495, 15CM371, 15CM372, 15CM435, 15CM664. ADA Kelly states agreement. Court reviews felony conviction consequences and constitutional rights with def. Court finds def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charges and possible penalties for counts 1, 4 and 7 in 15CF495. Def pleads guilty to counts 1 (stalking), 4 (Knowingly violate order) and 7 (bail jumping). 
Court uses complaints, reports and Prelim as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of counts 4 & 7. Court stays adjudication in count 1, pending compliance with Diversion agreement. 
Court reviews 2 year agreement for count 1 - Upon successful completion of the agreement Count 1 will be amended to Cty Ord. # 52 - Disorderly conduct and to pay forfeiture costs of $114.50 at completion. 
Counts 2, 3, 5, 6, 8 and 9 in 15CF495 are dismissed. Court dismisses 15CF375, 15CM371, 15CM372, 15CM435 and 15CM664.
Court orders in counts 4 and 7, concurrent - 1 year probation with conditions:
- Court costs of $243 for count 4 and DNA surcharge of $200.00 - apply bond on file in 15CM435. Payable through Clerk of Court.
- Court costs of $243 for count 7 and DNA surcharge of $200.00 - apply bond on file in 15CM435. Payable through Clerk of Court. 
- No abusive contact with Stacy Miggler.
- AODA and follow through with all recommendations, if required by probation.
- Absolute sobriety: Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medication (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. 
- No possession of firearms
- Domestic Violence assessment and follow through with all recommendations (follow through can be completed within the 2 year agreement)
- No abusive contact with Stacy Miggler
- Attend Victim Empathy Seminar with Restorative Justice

Defendant to receive 117 days credit against ultimate sentence. 

Defendant to meet with payment clerk and diversion coordinator. 
Sign up with probation today, June 29, 2016. 
Defendant advised of right to appeal. 

Bail continues, as amended.
UNSIGNED. eif
Risk Assessment (sealed). eif
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF375, 15CF495, 15CM371, 15CM372,15CM435 and 15CM664:
CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Liddle. ADA:  Megan E. Kelly   DF ATTY:  Daniel Frank Demaio   DF:  Joshua Ryan Miggler appeared. Case called at 10:17 a.m. Court notes these matters are set for a plea and sentencing hearing. ADA Kelly recites agreement. On file 15CF495, DE will plea and enter in a diversion agreement on Ct.1 Stalking, will plea to Ct.'s 4 & 7  and remaining open files will be dismissed. Court just received COMPAS this a.m. ADA Kelly addresses discrepancies on COMPAS. Court will let COMPAS stand is and will reset the plea and sentencing so the diversion agreement can be revised.  Bail is continued.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 29, 2016 at 09:00 am.

*AMENDED* 

INCLUDES: 15CF375, 15CF495, 15CM371, 15CM372, 15CM435 & 15CM664.

- COURT VACATES THE HOUSE ARREST AND THE DE NO LONGER HAS TO BE SUPERVISED BY JOHN AND NANCY MIGGLER WHEN LEAVING THE RESIDENCE 

 Bond is to be Co-Signed by the DE's father and mother, John and Nancy Miggler

- DE to reside at 13695 30th Street Cir., Stillwater, Minnesota 55082 with John and Nancy Miggler
-   Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Stacey M. or M.R.H..  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ordered that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis Stats.

Bail is continued on all files.  Set for arraignment on 15CF495.  15CF375, 15CM371, 15CM372, 15CM435 & 15CM664 (PTC). -Not to possess any weapons of any kind including knives other than dinner knives.

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  S.L.M.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
Defendant appeared via video conferencing from the St Croix County jail.
